html: As noted, Babylon’s destruction is a worldwide event (v 9; Isaiah 10:23 ). “The world,” “the wicked,” “insolent men,” and “tyrants” add to the list of entities that comprise Isaiah’s Greater Babylon. Jehovah puts an end to pride in that day. Whether of his own people or the nations, it is the same: “What will you do in the day of reckoning when the holocaust overtakes you from afar?” (Isaiah 10:3 ); “Jehovah of Hosts has a day in store for all the proud and arrogant and for all who are exalted, that they may be brought low” (Isaiah 2:12 ); “Tyrants shall come to nought and scorners cease” (Isaiah 29:20 ).
